briefdescription.para: the printer instance
A counter that gets increased each time the user creates a new display of the document with "Displays"->"New ...".
mainDock is the main DockWidget to which all other dockWidget will be dock.
clustersPanel is the DockWidget containing the ClusterPalette.
ClusterPalette is the Widget containing the cluster list.
Represents the document on which the application works.
tabsParent groups all the tabs, it is updated eache time a display is added.

detaileddescription.para: It is null when there is only one display open. It enables to get the active tab.

briefdescription.para: the configuration object of the application
Spine box enabling to choose the absciss dimension.
Spine box enabling to choose the ordinate dimension.
Boolean used to prevent the trigger of the spin box update during initialization.
The current number of undo used to enable/disable the the undo action.
The current number of redo used to enable/disable the the redo action.
Thread used to save a document as it can take 5 seconds.

detaileddescription.para: The thread is used only when using the save menu, on quit if a save is need it the thread is not call.

briefdescription.para: Amount of time used when looking for the spikes when the presentation mode is time frame.

detaileddescription.para: This amount is in second and the default is 30.

briefdescription.para: Starting time when looking for the spikes when the presentation mode is time frame.

detaileddescription.para: This amount is in second and the default is 0.

briefdescription.para: Spine box enabling to choose the start time used to display the waveforms while in time frame mode.
Small box where the user can enter the width of the time frame to use to display the waveforms while in time frame mode.
A validator for the time frame to use to display the waveforms while in time frame mode (.

simplesect.para: duration). The limits are zero and the maximun of time for the current document.

briefdescription.para: Spine box enabling to choose the number of spikes to display in the waveform view, if any, while that view is in sample mode.
The step used to increase or decrease the number of spikes to display in the waveform view, if any, while that view is in sample mode.
Length of the recording in miliseconds.
Small box where the user can enter the width of half the time frame to use to compute the correlograms.
Small box where the user can enter the size of the bins to use to compute the correlograms.
Time frame to use to compute the correlograms.
Size of the bins to use to compute the correlograms.
A validator for the bin size of the correlations.

detaileddescription.para: The range is between 0-1 and the maximun of time for the current document in miliseconds.

briefdescription.para: A validator for the time frame used to compute the correlations.
Settings dialog.
Time interval between 2 lines drawn in the cluster views when the time dimension is selected.
Initial gain used to display the waveforms in the waveform views.
Position of the channels in the waveform views.
Background color for the views.
Widget launching external process and displaying its output.
True if the external process has exited, false otherwise.
Widget embeding the output of the external process.
True if all the outputs of the external process have been printed, false otherwise.
List of the clusters to recluster.
List of the clusters created by the reclustering.
Path to the reclustering executable.
Arguments for the reclustering executable.
Name of the reclustering fet file.
True if the process has been killed through Klusters.
True if a Error Martix exists, false otherwise.
The path of the currently open document.
The size of half the time frame for the correlations has to be k*bineSize, as the total number of bins = 2*halfbins + 1 (halfBins.5 for each half time frame).
Construtor of KlustersApp, calls all init functions to create the application.
Opens a file, only one document at the time is allowed.

detaileddescription.para: Asking for a new one will open a new instance of the application with it.

briefdescription.para: Imports a file using the old format, only one document at the time is allowed.

detaileddescription.para: Asking for a new one will open a new instance of the application with it.

briefdescription.para: Returns the view contains in the active display.
Returns true if the active display contains the output of a process, false otherwise.
Adds a new view (ClusterView, WaveformView or CorrelationView) to the active display.

parameterdescription.para: type of view to add (ClusterView,WaveformView or CorrelationView).
KDockWidget to which the new view will be docked.

briefdescription.para: Updates the menu due to the removal of a view (ClusterView, WaveformView or CorrelationView) in the active display.

parameterdescription.para: type of view to add (ClusterView,WaveformView or CorrelationView).

briefdescription.para: Informs of the existance of an Error Matrix View in the application.

ordinate dimension.

type of scale used to present the correlation data.

briefdescription.para: queryExit is called by KDocMainWindow when the last window of the application is going to be closed during the closeEvent().

detaileddescription.para: Its purpose is purely to prepare the application (with possible user interaction) so it can safely be closed later (without user interaction).

briefdescription.para: This function is called when it is time for Klusters to save its properties for session management purposes.
This function is called when this Klusters is restored.

detaileddescription.para:
The KConfig object points to the session management config file that was saved. with
saveProperties

briefdescription.para: Event filter to catch right click for contextual menu.

parameterdescription.para: target object for the event.
event sent.

briefdescription.para: queryClose is called by KDocMainWindow call just before being closed.
Shows or hide the parameters boxes base on the user settings.
Executes the preferences dialog.
Updates the widgets so that new user settings take effect.
Initializes some of the variables defined in the settings (preferences).
Open a file and load it into the document.
Opens a file in the old format and load it into the document.
Opens a file from the recent files menu.
Save the document.
Renumbers the cluster and save the document.
Save the document with a new filename.
Asks for saving if the file is modified, then closes the actual file and window.
Prints the views in the current display, for multiple-view displays, each view is printed on a separate page.
Closes the document and quits the application.
Reverts the last user action.
Reverts the last undo action.
Display the configure key bindings dialog.
Toggles the main tool bar.
Toggles the status bar.
Toggles the bar for the actions.
Toggles the bar for the tools.
Toggles the bar for the parameters.
Toggles the user cluster information in the cluster palette.
Creates a new cluster display for the document and adds the new display to the list of displays the document maintains.
Creates a new waveform display for the document and adds the new display to the list of displays the document maintains.
Creates a new crosscorrelation display for the document and adds the new display to the list of displays the document maintains.
Creates a new overview display for the document and adds the new display to the list of displays the document maintains.
Creates a new grouping assistant display for the document and adds the new display to the list of displays the document maintains.
Creates a new trace display for the document and adds the new display to the list of displays the document maintains.
Changes the statusbar contents for the standard label permanently, used to indicate current actions.

parameterdescription.para: the text that is displayed in the statusbar

briefdescription.para: Gets called when the window menu is activated; recreates the window menu with all opened window titles.
Activates the MDI child widget when it gets selected from the window menu.
Changes to a mode enabling the creation of a single cluster by selecting an area.
Changes to a mode enabling the creation of a multiple clusters by selecting an area.
Changes to a mode enabling the deletion of spikes from a cluster and move them to the cluster (number 1) containing the poorly isolated cells.
Changes to a mode enabling the deletion of spikes from a cluster and move them to the cluster (number 0) containing the artefacts.
Changes to a mode enabling the user to zoom.
Chooses the selection time tool, enabling the user to select a time frame for which the traces are going to be displayed in the TraceView.

detaileddescription.para: This slot is accessible only if a TraceView and a ClusterView are present and if one of the dimensions in the ClusterView is the time.

briefdescription.para: Redraws a cluster because his color has been changed.

parameterdescription.para: id of the cluster to redraw.

briefdescription.para: Draws the clusters contain in selectedClusters list.

parameterdescription.para: list of clusters which have been selected to be shown.

briefdescription.para: Groups the clusters contain in selectedClusters list and trigger the update of the displays.

parameterdescription.para: list of clusters which have been selected to be grouped.

briefdescription.para: Calls the document to move the clusters contain in selectedClusters list to the cluster of noise (cluster 1) and trigger the update of the displays.

parameterdescription.para: list of clusters which have been selected to be moved

briefdescription.para: Calls the document to move the clusters contain in selectedClusters list to the cluster of artefact (cluster 0) and trigger the update of the displays.

parameterdescription.para: list of clusters which have been selected to be moved

briefdescription.para: Sets the selection mode to immediate, disenabling the update action.
Set the selection mode to delay, enabling the update action.
Updates the palette and the spine boxes when the active display changes.
Triggers an update of the dimensions due to a change of the absciss dimension.
Triggers an update of the dimensions due to a change of the ordinate dimension.
Closes the display and if it is the last one asks for saving, then closes the actual file and window.
Updates the number of undo.
Updates the number of redo.
Informs the active display to present the waveforms for an updated time frame.
Informs the active display to present the waveforms for an updated time frame.
Sets the presentation mode of the waveform view of the active display.

detaileddescription.para: It can be either the sample mode or the time frame mode. In the sample mode, for each shown cluster, only one out of the number of spikes to be displayed will be shown, the time frame mode, for each shown cluster, only the spikes within the current time frame will be shown.

briefdescription.para: Sets the waveforms of each cluster in the active display to overlay or be side by side.
Sets the way of presenting the information concerning the waveforms selected in the active display.

detaileddescription.para: It can be either the mean presentation or the normal presentation. In the mean presentation, there is only the waveforms of the mean and the standard deviation. In the normal presentation all the waveforms for the selected (depending on the sample/time frame mode) spikes are shown.

briefdescription.para: Triggers the increase of the amplitude of the waveforms in the waveform view.
Triggers the decrease of the amplitude of the waveforms in the waveform view.
Informs the active display to present an updated number of waveforms when the waveformView is in sample mode.
Informs the active display to present the correlations with a new time frame.
Informs the active display to present the correlations with a new size for the bins.
Triggers the increase of the amplitude of the correlograms in the correlation view.
Triggers the decrease of the amplitude of the correlograms in the correlation view.
Present the correlograms with the raw data without appling any scale.
Presents the correlograms scaling the data by the maximum value.
Present the correlograms scaling the data by the shoulder value.
Informs the active display to update the drawing of a doted line at the shoulder level on the correlograms.
Triggers the update of the errorMatrix view in the grouping assistant view.
Select all the clusters.
Selects all the clusters except the clusters of artefact and noise (clusters 0 and 1 respectively).
Launchs a separate process to recluster the selected clusters.
Stops the separate process which is reclustering some clusters.
Triggers the update of data incorporating the new data from the reclustering.

parameterdescription.para: process which has just finished.

briefdescription.para: Updates internal state indicating that the outputs of the separate process, which has been killed, is finished.
Launches a dialog to enable the user to change the tab label of the active display.
Triggers the increase of the amplitude of all the channels.
Triggers the decrease of the amplitude of all the channels.
Enables or disables the display of labels next to the traces.
Retrieves the next cluster.
Retrieves the previous cluster.
Updates, if needed, the browsing possibility of the traceView.
Initializes the KActions of the application.
Initializes the different parameter widgets.
Sets up the statusbar for the main window by initialzing a statuslabel.
Creates the palette of clusters (left tool view).
Initialize the first display (create the mainDockWidget).
Creates a new display.

parameterdescription.para: enum representing the type of view to be created.

briefdescription.para: Updates the active display due to a change of one of the dimensions.

parameterdescription.para: absciss dimension.
ordinate dimension.

briefdescription.para: Resets the state of the application to a none document open state.
Updates the acess to the undo/redo mechanism.
The Klusters main window and central class.

detaileddescription.para:
It sets up the main window and reads the config file as well as providing a menubar, toolbar and statusbar. There is only one document open by application. In initClusterPanel(), the palette for the clusters is created. View windows are created in createView().The MDI child is an instance of KlustersView, the document an instance of KlustersDoc. KlustersApp reimplements the methods that DockMainWindow provides for main window handling and supports full session management as well as keyboard accelerator configuration.
Lynn Hazan
